newsitem.title: USA: Tobacco companies say national settlement needed.
newsitem.headline: Tobacco companies say national settlement needed.

text.p: The leading U.S. cigarette makers on Thursday said their settlement of the state of Mississippi's Medicaid lawsuit underscores the importance of a national resolution of tobacco-related litigation.

"The settlement resolves certain legal and financial issues in one state, but it does not -- and could not -- address broader issues of concern in Mississippi and throughout the nation," the companies said in a statement.
The companies said the $368.5 billion proposal agreed to last month represents a plan to reduce youth access to tobacco products and to preserve the rights of adults who choose to smoke.

"The Mississippi settlement is a step toward achieving this goal...Today's state action ends one case, but it does not end the need for a national solution of the tobacco conflict," the companies said.
